practice.question: What is a भाष्य?
practice.explanation: Bhāṣya is a scholarly commentary on a root text.

practice.question: Listen: ॐ भूर्भुवः स्वः तत्सवितुर्वरेण्यं भर्गो देवस्य धीमहि। What do we meditate on?
practice.explanation: Gāyatrī mantra: we meditate (धीमहि) on the glory (भर्गः) of the divine Savitṛ.

practice.question: Listen: धियो यो नः प्रचोदयात्। What do we pray for?
Listen: ईशावास्यमिदं सर्वं यत्किञ्च जगत्यां जगत्। What envelops everything?
practice.explanation: Īśāvāsyopaniṣad: all this (इदं सर्वं) is pervaded by the Lord (ईश).

practice.question: Listen: तेन त्यक्तेन भुञ्जीथा। How should we enjoy?
practice.explanation: तेन त्यक्तेन – by/through that which is renounced; enjoy with detachment.

practice.question: Listen: मा गृधः कस्यस्विद्धनम्। What should we not do?
practice.explanation: मा गृधः – do not covet; कस्यस्विद्धनम् – whose is wealth (anyway)?

practice.question: Listen (Gītā 2.47): कर्मण्येवाधिकारस्ते मा फलेषु कदाचन। To what do we have a right?
practice.explanation: Karma yoga: we have right only to action (कर्मणि), not to results (फलेषु).

practice.question: Listen (Gītā 18.66): सर्वधर्मान्परित्यज्य मामेकं शरणं व्रज। Where should one take refuge?
practice.explanation: Krishna asks to abandon all dharmas and take refuge in Him alone (मामेकं शरणं व्रज).

practice.question: Listen (Gītā 3.35): श्रेयान्स्वधर्मो विगुणः परधर्मात्। What is better than another's dharma well performed?
practice.explanation: स्वधर्मः (one's own dharma) even with faults is better than परधर्म (another's dharma) well done.

practice.question: What is a सूत्र (sūtra)?
practice.explanation: Sūtra is an aphorism - minimal words, maximum meaning; needs commentary.

practice.question: What does व्याख्या mean?
practice.explanation: व्याख्या (vyākhyā) is detailed explanation or commentary on a root text.

reading.title: Bhagavad Gītā 2.47
reading.sanskrit: कर्मण्येवाधिकारस्ते मा फलेषु कदाचन। मा कर्मफलहेतुर्भूर्मा ते सङ्गोऽस्त्वकर्मणि॥
reading.romanization: karmaṇyevādhikāraste mā phaleṣu kadācana. mā karmaphalaheturbhūrmā te saṅgo'stvakarmaṇi.
reading.english: You have a right to action alone, never to its fruits. Let not the fruits of action be your motive, nor let your attachment be to inaction.

reading.title: Bhagavad Gītā 18.66
reading.sanskrit: सर्वधर्मान्परित्यज्य मामेकं शरणं व्रज। अहं त्वां सर्वपापेभ्यो मोक्षयिष्यामि मा शुचः॥
reading.romanization: sarvadharmān parityajya mām ekaṃ śaraṇaṃ vraja. ahaṃ tvāṃ sarvapāpebhyo mokṣayiṣyāmi mā śucaḥ.
reading.english: Abandon all dharmas and take refuge in Me alone. I shall liberate you from all sins; do not grieve.
